oai_dc:dc.dc:title: The Abelianisation of the real Cremona group
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Zimmermann, Susanna
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Mathematics - Algebraic Geometry
14E07, 14P99
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: We present the Abelianisation of the birational transformations of $\mathbb{P}_{\mathbb{R}}^2$. Its kernel is equal to the normal subgroup generated by $\mathrm{PGL}_3(\mathbb{R})$, and contains all elements of degree $\leq4$. The description of the quotient yields the existence of normal subgroups of index $2^n$ for any $n$ and implies that any normal subgroup generated by a countable set of elements is a proper subgroup. This also holds for the group of birational diffeomorphisms respectively of $\mathbb{P}_{\mathbb{R}}^2$, $\mathbb{A}^2_{\mathbb{R}}$ and the sphere.
Comment: are welcome. The text now includes statements about the group of birational diffeomorphisms of the sphere and the torus
